meanings.definition: Excessively concerned with minor details or rules.
meanings.sent1: She is so pedantic about grammar that she corrects everyone's speech.
meanings.sent2: The pedantic teacher always insists on following the strict classroom rules.
meanings.sent3: The pedantic librarian organized the books by color instead of genre, just to be different.
meanings.sent4: His pedantic focus on punctuation turned his writing into a masterpiece of precision.
meanings.sent5: The pedantic chef measured each ingredient with meticulous care to ensure a perfect dish.

meanings.sent1: The pedantic professor loved to show off his extensive vocabulary in class.
meanings.sent2: Her pedantic behavior at the lecture made it clear she wanted everyone to know how smart she was.
meanings.sent3: The pedantic student wore glasses with fake lenses to appear more intellectual.
meanings.sent4: His pedantic display of knowledge intimidated his classmates.
meanings.sent5: The pedantic scientist always used complex jargon to impress his peers.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a narrow, often ostentatious concern for book learning and formal rules.
meanings.sent1: The pedantic scholar only cared about academic achievements and citations.
meanings.sent2: Her pedantic attitude towards literature made her seem unapproachable.
meanings.sent3: The pedantic book club member insisted on discussing the symbolism of every paragraph.
meanings.sent4: His pedantic approach to history made him an expert in ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent5: The pedantic lawyer always quoted legal precedents to support his arguments.
